direction.raw_text: : On credit sequence...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stretched out.  Long, alabaster white.  Beautiful.  A WASH CLOTH enters frame.  Starts washing the arm with long, tender strokes. A TUMBLE OF HAIR thick and auburn.  Being gently washed. FINGERNAILS being clipped with a shiny nail clipper.  Short.  Uniform. Tidy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: brown with a touch of gold.  A BRUSH comes into view. Brushes against the eyebrow hair, then back again.  Against. Then back again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TY-HOSE pulled gingerly off a long leg.  Folded neatly.  The wash cloth begins between the toes.  Warm, soapy water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now dry.  The HAND appears with a comb.  Pulls down through the thick tresses. It is only now that we see the hand is wearing a SURGICAL GLOVE. The gloved hand holds up the comb and pulls stray hairs from it.  Places them in a big, clear, plastic bag.  In the bag we see the panty-hose, a folded flower dress, the nail clippings. Goes back to combing.  Comes across a knot and yanks the comb through.  The HEAD rolls over to us.  Her face is bruised, her eyes blank.  She is lying on the floor. Dead. End of credit sequence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The loud THRUM of a bush plane.  We CLOSE ON a small, cloudy window.  Through it we see an endless expanse of pine trees.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Jesus.  Just look at all that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to reveal HAP ECKHART and WILL DORMER sitting side by side.  Hap's at the window.  Greying moustache, a little pudgy, wearing a brown suit.  Holding a folded over Seattle Times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will's eyes remain on the file on his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will Dormer.  Tall, handsome, expensively tailored suit. Snakeskin cowboy boots.  There's both a magnetism and a distance to him.  An intense mixture.  Hap glances at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will looks up.  We see the trace of a thick, ropy SCAR by his Adam's apple.  There's tension between him and Hap, just below the surface.  He taps the file.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I thought we had a population problem. Everyone should just move up here. (taps window) Just look at it, Will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't need to look at it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing wrong with smelling the roses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell that to her, partner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a stack of 8x10 PHOTOGRAPHS.  Of the dead girl.  Her eyes puffed up from bruises.  The whites bloody.  Contusions along her breasts and shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The PILOT's looking back at Will.  Wearing a leather red baron hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will nods.  The plane lurches.  The file falls to the floor and the photographs scatter.  The pilot catches a glimpse of them.  Looks at Will.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Detective?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Better check your belts.  We'll be landing in about fifteen minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The small yellow plane veers left.  Clears a mountain top and gives view to the spectacular Alaskan coastline.  The green of the Bering sea, the blanket of pine trees, the jagged rock of the beaches.  Enormous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swinging in the wind: Nightmute, Alaska.  Halibut Fishing Capital of the World!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to reveal it hanging from the eave of a small, corrugated building.  The "airport."  Nothing else for miles around. A mud-splattered Jeep Cherokee pulls up next to it.  Brakes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  A YOUNG WOMAN hops out.  About 23.  Petite with short, brown hair. Peers up at the sky.  Brightens at the sight of the BUSH PLANE coming in for landing.  Smooths down her down vest. Making sure the GOLD SHIELD on her belt's visible.  Nervous. Excited.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Eleanor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns.  Shields her eyes from the sun.  An OLD MAN hosing down the side of the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie puffs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old man screws up his face, confused. MR. ANGSTROM (cont'd) Didn't you used to baby-sit for us? ELLIE I don't babysit any more, Mr. Angstrom. Just made detective three weeks ago.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Mr. Angstrom!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ANGSTROM What're you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Police business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . ANGSTROM Police business?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: jumps down off the roof.  Angstrom sprays it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie, used to not being taken seriously.  Turns back to THE ROAR of the bush plane as it taxis down the strip.  Coming to a stop.  She hurries over as the door swings open and...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . ANGSTROM Boy, Charlie must be short-handed down at the station.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: steps down.  Slipping on his sunglasses. Scanning the nothingness around him.  Spots the swinging sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hap, right behind him.  Rubs his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look down.  Ellie reaches up and takes Will's bag.  Then his hand.  Shakes it vigorously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will motions to Hap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leads them away from the plane.  Takes Will's briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Opens the back of the Jeep.  Puts the bags inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pilot walks by.  Taps her on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks back at Will.  Can't help but focus in on his scar. Touches her own smooth neck.  In awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will smiles, taken aback by this girl's exuberance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She throws a quick glance at Angstrom.  Out of ear-shot.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: "Halibut fishing capital of the world."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This ought to be interesting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (over the engine) Detective Dormer!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) It's a huge honor to meet you!  Ellie Burr.  I'm here to take you to the station!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My partner...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Detective Eckhart!  I know!  Welcome to Nightmute!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just want to say how incredible it is to have you working with us, Detective Dormer.  I've followed all your cases. Theodore Dineli, Frank and Casey Prud'homme, the Port Angeles shootings...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) ...And especially the Leland Street Murders.  That was my case study at the Academy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell your dad the game's gonna start late this week, Ellie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure thing, Spence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) That's where Ronald Langley cut you in the basement of his father's house on 325 Leland, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did your homework, Officer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just made detective three weeks ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Cherokee parked next to a police car outside a plain, one- storey building.  The Nightmute Police Department.  A totem pole stands out front.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Will Dormer!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nightmute Police Chief CHARLES NYBACK gets up from behind his desk with a big smile.  Ruddy, red hair sprinkled with grey, Nyback wears a faded army sweater over his uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Limps from behind his desk and gives Will a shake and a slap on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nyback shakes Hap's hand.  A reunion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks at Will.  Down at his boots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will.  Looks at Nyback's gut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They LAUGH.  Eyes twinkling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts back over to his desk.  Notices Ellie still standing by the door.  Points to Will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie straightens.  Smiles.  Looks over at Will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie, realises they want to be alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Backs out.  Quietly closing the door behind her.  Will unbuttons his jacket.  Takes a seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will surveys the fishing poles leaning against the gun rack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hap picks up a cheap trophy.  Reads the base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nyback nods to Hap's Seattle Times.  The headline:  "Deeper Investigation into Special Branch"...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will and Hap share a look.  No more joking.  Hap folds over the paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nyback winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nyback pulls a stack of messages from his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hap tosses a glance over at Will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nyback turns and ceremoniously drops the messages into the trash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cloud passes over his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holds up a file.  The name written on the lip:  KAY CONNELL.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be damned!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (warmly) How you doing, Charlie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Charlie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Christ.  I haven't seen you boys since...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just after Leland Street.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that, then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eight years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seven years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seven years?  Where does it all go?  That was some amazing time, though, wasn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You haven't changed a bit, Will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have, Chief.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew that was coming.  I deserve it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Pay attention to this man, Ellie.  He'll teach you how to be a great cop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all, for now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.  Right.  Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nice kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sits with a SIGH) Got a love affair with police work. Drives me crazy with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keeping you busy up here, Charlie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "2nd prize Great Kodiak Salmon Catch."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you seven years ago this was a stepping stone to retirement.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Looks like it's a good time for you to get up here, too.  With all the bad business going on down at Special Branch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Just five bad apples so far?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So far.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the D.A. got them on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Four unwarranted shootings, witness intimidation, and cocaine theft.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How about you?  How you faring?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're all over us, Charlie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're all over everybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .A.'s calling themselves the "Corruption Task Force."  Can you believe that? Trying to root out any mistakes or "oversights" any other Detectives may have made over the years.  They're turning it into a witch hunt.  Something on the news about it practically every night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got a bunch of messages here from some guy named Warfield.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's I.A.'s pit bull.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wants me to keep him posted on all your movements up here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I'm just glad Buck could spare you a couple of weeks.  Take you out of the frenzy.  I gotta tell you, though, I sure don't miss big city police work.  Not that I was ever a great detective.  But up here there's no Bureaucracy.  No Public Relations.  No blurred lines. Just good guys and bad guys.  Simple.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Except for this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nyback leads Will and Hap down a hallway.  Crooked plaques and black-and-white pictures line the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn a corner and stop at a door.  Will glances up:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Couldn't get a thing from the body.  Not a trace.  Town's never dealt with anything like this before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hanging over it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nyback opens the door onto...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I've briefed everybody about your coming. They know to follow your lead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ...the bullpen of Nightmute PD.  Wooden desks, a couple computers, a jumbled corkboard, an impressive gun cabinet.  A RADIO's playing. Three MEN look over.  A young uniformed cop and two guys with heavy facial hair, Timberland boots, and flannel shirts.  One of them's part Inuit.  Ellie sits in the back.  Reaches over to turn off the radio. Will and Hap stand in the doorway.  Sticking out like sore thumbs in their suits.  Nyback jerks his thumb towards them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Inuit, FRED DUGGAR, snorts.  Takes his feet of the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will puts out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fred tugs at his dark handlebar moustache.  Stands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is Detective Dormer and his partner Detective Eckhart.  On loan from Buck Lundgard, Seattle Robbery and Homicide Special Branch.  They'll be helping with the Connell case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Helping? CHIEF NYBACK (ignoring him) Anything they need to see, you show them; anywhere they want to go, you take them. (nods to Fred) This is Detective Fred Duggar.  He's been leading the investigation up to now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Detective...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Suppose you want to see the body.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fred steps out of the station, pulls on a baseball cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heads off across the parking lot.  Will and Hap exchange a glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn.  Ellie's come up behind them.  Looks over at the hunched figure to Fred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fred stops up ahead.  Sees her.  Annoyed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We can walk from here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guess that's what they call Alaskan hospitality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Don't worry about him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) He's just mad 'cause you're taking over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ellie!  Go type something!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON a faucet.  A bead of water, quivering at the mouth. Falls with a BLIP!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Did a fundascopic examination and found papilledema and petechiae of the retina.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to reveal Will, Hap, and the COUNTY CORONER standing by a stainless steel table.  The naked body of KAY CONNELL is laid out before them.  Fred hangs back. The coroner tugs at her surgical gloves.  She's in her late seventies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will points to the bruises on the body's shoulders and breasts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The coroner starts to cover the body with a sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will stays her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls the sheet back down.  Studying the body of Kay Connell.  Starts walking slowly around the table.  In his element.  The faucet drips.  Drips.  Drips. He bends down to smell her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Takes a handful and lets it fall from his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Continues around the table.  Picks up one of her hands. Examines her fingers, her nails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Continues down around her feet.  Checks between her first and second toes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will stands there.  Looking down at the body.  Slim.  Young. Beautiful.  Skin like marble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will looks up and locks eyes with his partner.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Clear cause of death was herniation of the brain stem due to intracerebral hemorrhage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beaten to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beaten to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about these contusions?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Superficial.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any signs of rape?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: None.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) She was a nice girl.  Played flute with my granddaughter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) He washed her hair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Combed it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Cleaned under her fingernails.  Clipped them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Toes, too. (to Fred) You found nothing on the body?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No fibers, skin flakes, hairs...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like I said, no.  We know about those things up here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He knew exactly what we'd be looking for. Made sure to cover up all his tracks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Even the best make mistakes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will and Hap enter the lobby of the Pioneer Lodge.  Big stone fireplace and heavy ceiling beams.  MOOSE ANTLERS mounted above reception.  They put their bags down by the desk.  Look around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn.  RACHEL CLEMENT stands in a doorway behind the desk.  Dunking a teabag into a mug.  Long dark hair and intelligent eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hap smiles at her.  Will checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel looks at him.  Goes to a small file box on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He glances out the window.  It's as bright as day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hands them two cards.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Lower forty-eight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lower forty-eight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not from here.  I can tell by your walk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh?  And how's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Unsure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Detectives Will Dormer and Hap Eckhart. There should be a reservation for us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hap) Your friend's all business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm always all business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Is it really 9:30?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) Alaskan summers.  Hope you're an easy sleeper.  It'll be like this all night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Sign here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will's taken off his jacket and is unpacking.  The room is sparse and creaky.  Bed dips in the middle.  He hangs a jacket in the armoire then returns to his suitcase.  Pulls out his SMITH AND WESSON 45. Lays it on the bedside table.  Takes out a shoulder holster. A back holster.  A handful of shells.  Lays them on the table.  Then a small SMITH AND WESSON 39/13 9MM.  Checks the magazine. There's a KNOCK on the adjoining door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will SLAPS the magazine back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hap opens the door.  A glimpse into his room: family PICTURES on his bedside table - a WOMAN and three teenage GIRLS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks over to the big window.  It overlooks the harbor. Big, snow-capped mountains in the distance.  One lone TUGBOAT in the harbor towing a freighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will reaches into his suitcase.  Pulls out a shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will throws him a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will goes back to his suitcase.  Hap follows.  A thin film of sweat on his upper lip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will flares up.  Struck a nerve.  Turns to his partner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs a hanger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes out a handkerchief.  Wipes his brow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will turns on his partner, eyes burning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The partners, lock eyes.  Years of working together.  A thousand things unsaid.  Hap reaches for the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See you have the same decor as my room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Same view, too. (looks out) I've been watching that tugboat for the last half hour.  So small, pulling all that weight. (beat) We have to talk, Will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want to talk about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll talk when we get back to Seattle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When's that, a week?  Two weeks?... (heads over to him) We have to figure out a plan of action now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know my plan of action.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To do nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dammit, Will.  Warfield had me locked up in his office again for five hours yesterday.  Five hours.  Asking all kinds of questions...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's asking everybody questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But he's zeroing in on me.  On us. Everyone's talking about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's just rattling your cage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I gotta tell you.  With a wife, three kids, and a pension plan in the balance, it's rattling hard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We say nothing.  It goes away.  Simple as that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lowers voice) Look.  We've tampered with evidence. We've pushed witnesses.  We've planted shit.  And they're sniffing around like dogs.  Especially on the Dobbs case...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Weston Dobbs killed an eight year-old boy and left him hanging in the basement like a piece of meat.  You remember that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know I remember that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One word to I.A. and he walks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe not.  We could talk to Buck...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cut some kind of a deal.  I heard that's what Flynn's doing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mike Flynn's a dirty cop, Hap!  We are nothing like Mike Flynn.  We did what we needed to do to make sure that son-of- bitch Dobbs paid for what he did.  And every bastard like him.  We say one word about it and every case we ever brought in is going to blow wide open and they'll all walk.  Every last one.  And I am not going to let that happen.  No deals.  No compromises.  No discussions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddammit, Will.  You grab on to something and you don't let it go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know if it's because you think it's the right thing to do or because your pride won't let you do anything else.  I can't tell any more. (steps back) But I can tell you one thing.  I'm getting too old for this cowboy cop stuff.  Breaking the rules.  Cleaning up messes.  We're a dying breed, Will. You're a dying breed.  I.A., the D.A., all those reporters - they don't care what you did at Leland Street seven years ago.  They don't care that you've made this your life.  They don't care about getting the bad guy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I care.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will's asleep.  Kay Connell's folder open on his chest.  It's dark in his room, quiet.  Suddenly the shade on his window quivers and SNAPS up, flooding the room with light. Will's eyes pop open.  He rolls over to look at the clock:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :15.  Squinting, he gets up and walks over to the window. We can see the rest of his scar.  Runs down deep across his sternum. He yanks the shade back down.  It bucks, then settles. Satisfied, Will returns to bed.  Plumps the pillow, pulls the blanket up around him.  Closes his eyes. The shade lurches halfway.  Then SNAPS back up.  Light pours in.  Will's eyes open.

dialogue.raw_text: You got to be kidding me.

direction.raw_text: Will jogs along in a Sonics sweatshirt, a ring of sweat around his collar.  He looks out over the harbor.  Fishing boats coming in with their early morning haul.  More halibut. He checks his watch.  Slows to a walk.  Looks up and sees... Ellie Burr standing on the front steps of the Pioneer Lodge. Smiles.  Holds up some car keys.

dialogue.raw_text: Habit.

direction.raw_text: skips down Will's spine.  He looks at her.

He finishes that side.  Starts to stretch the blanket across the window.  Hesitates.  Looks outside.  To the left.  To the right.  To see if anybody's out there.  If anybody's watching.  Sees instead...

direction.raw_text: chugging across the harbor.  Pulling a huge freighter.  Will squeezes his eyes shut.  Opens them again. Pulls the blanket fully across the window.

direction.raw_text: :05 A.M. The FILES spread across the floor.  Their edges buckled from the rain.  Dozens of pictures of Kay Connell.  School records.  Private letters.  Health files.  Coroner's report. Will.  Pacing.  Back and forth.  Thinking.  Over that same
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: floorboard.  The clock reads: 1:05.

direction.raw_text: :20 A.M. Will lying in bed.  On top of the blanket.  Wide awake. Staring at the ADJOINING DOOR.  Into Hap's room.

direction.raw_text: Will, in a sweatshirt and coat, heads down the front steps of the Pioneer Lodge.  Jams his hands in his pockets.  The walk of an insomniac.

direction.raw_text: Will walking down main street.  In the middle of the road. The dead of night.  No cars.  The sky a blinding white. Hears some rowdy NOISE coming from a corner bar, beer lights flickering.  A WOMAN rides by on a bicycle.  Birds SINGING. Not day.  Not night.  Stuck somewhere in between.  Like a dream. Turns down a side street.  Passing more stores.  Guns and Ammo.  Patty's Hair and Nails.  General Store.  Comes upon
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: where he vomited the day before.  Stops.  Sees the DEAD DOG, still down at the end.  Half obscured by the dumpster. Will wavers, pale.  Suddenly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: emerges from the shadows.  Big.  Wild-eyed. Awakened from his sleep.  Will, quickly backtracks to the sidewalk.  Spooked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the CRACK! of bat hitting ball.  He turns.  In the distance.  Nightmute Elementary School.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little League game in full swing.  The uniforms, a little faded.  The diamond, a little unkempt.  A smattering of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Mostly dads with six-packs. Will wanders over to the fence.  Spots Ellie sitting alone on the bottom bleacher.

direction.raw_text: .  From afar.  The SOUNDS of the game, delayed a few seconds.  Watches as Will crosses to the bleachers...

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will leans back.  Stretching his legs.  Remembering.

direction.raw_text: The row of DADS behind them.  Jump up and start CHEERING.

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Detective Dormer!  What are you doing here? (looks at watch) It's two-thirty in the morning. Shouldn't you be asleep?

dialogue.raw_text: I could say the same thing about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.  We always have play-offs in the middle of the night.  It's the best time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's playing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Puffins and the Hawks.  We're in extra innings.  The Hawks have a really good line-up this year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's my sister.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (calling out) That's okay, Lib! (to Will) Usually she's better.

dialogue.raw_text: She your only sibling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) Twelve years younger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) What about you?  You have any siblings?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. (rubs his eyes) Well.  I had a brother.  He died when I was eleven.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I shouldn't have...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay.  Happened a long time ago.  He was killed in a fire.  In New Mexico.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That must have been awful for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not really. (slight smile) I remember I was more embarrassed that he had died.  Embarrassed that it made me different.  So I didn't tell the other kids at school what had happened.  They'd ask me where he was, where he'd gone.  And I'd make up stories.  He was visiting an aunt up north, he'd broken his leg, he was in a Swiss boarding school.  Stuff like that. (shakes his head) Nice kid, huh?  Just kept making up more and more lies...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  Sees him sit up.  Look around.  That same prickle at the back of his neck.  A KID slides home just as...

The smell of formaldehyde.  Bloody instruments on a stainless steel tray. Walks towards the clipboard, eyes flicking over to the shape under the sheet when...

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Just enough time to reflect.

direction.raw_text: Nothing.  Someone's there but they're not saying anything. Will, too tired for this shit...

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Dormer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Goddammit, Warfield, if you're gonna check up on me every...

dialogue.raw_text: I bet you haven't been getting much sleep.

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You lower-48s.  You think the white nights are kind of neat.  Then you can't sleep for days.  I've seen it happen about a million times.  But you can't sleep for a different reason.

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) Who is this?

direction.raw_text: .  Will loosens his tie.

direction.raw_text: The voice.  Dropping to a WHISPER.

direction.raw_text: Will, furrows his brow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into phone) I said, who is this?

dialogue.raw_text: I saw what really happened, Will...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw you kill your partner.  With your back-up weapon.  Out there on the beach. I saw you shoot him dead...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON Will Dormer's face. As all the blood drains from it. As all SOUND fades around him. As his heart begins to POUND against his chest. He falters, reaching out for the desk.  To steady himself. As if the floor's just dropped out beneath him.  Eyes, darting around the bullpen...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto, into phone) Now you listen to me...

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry.  I won't tell anyone.  Oh, and I saw you take my gun.  My uncle's old 357.  I dropped it in the rocks. But you can go ahead and keep that.

direction.raw_text: exits his office.  Looks at Will and smiles.

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) ...I mean... (beat) ...Now that we're partners.

direction.raw_text: .  The line goes dead. Will, throat constricted.  Listening to the DIAL TONE. Smiles back at Nyback.  Turns.  Slowly hangs up the phone. White as a sheet.  Trying to act normal.  Trying to act calm.

direction.raw_text: returning to the bullpen, like nothing's different. Looks over at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sitting on the edge of the secretary's desk.  He reaches for it.  Carefully, rips the packing tape.  Bends back a flap. Inside, some dark blue material.  An embroidered daisy. Kay Connell's knapsack.

direction.raw_text: Will, heading for the Cherokee.  Clutching the box.  Face pale, pace quick.  Everything's different now.

direction.raw_text: He closes his eyes.  Now is not the time.  Reaches the Cherokee.  Yanks open the driver's side door.  Ellie catches up with him.  Out of breath.

direction.raw_text: She smiles, holds up some PHOTOGRAPHS.  They're of the BEACH. The ones Kepp took.  Almost all fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will.  Barely glancing at them.  Tosses the box into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gets in and closes the door.  Puts his hand over the box. Ellie comes up to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, about to seriously lose his shit.  Looks at Ellie. Eyes dark, distant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns the ignition.  Pulls out with a SQUEAL.  Ellie steps back, watching him drive away.  More curious than stung.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Detective Dormer!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look like you're in a hurry.  I just wanted to ask you about these pictures.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I know they're not great quality, but this is where you said you were when you first saw Detective Eckhart, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But here's the thing.  I retraced your exact steps according to your statement. You couldn't have seen Detective Eckhart from there.  I mean, not in that fog.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then change it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much closer would you say you were?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't remember.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Five feet?  Seven feet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, Ellie.  I don't have time for this shit.  Five feet, seven feet, twenty feet.  Put down whatever you want in your report, alright?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Cherokee.  Parked off-road.  A remote spot by the water. The driver's side door, left open.  The PING-PING-PING of the interior BELL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will Dormer, walking along a breakfront.  Aimless.  One foot in front of the other.  Staring out at nothing.  The endless sea.  Waves CRASHING.  Wind HOWLING.  Seagulls SCREECHING. Everything.  Closing in on him... He stumbles over a rock.  Grabs his head in his hands. Stunned.  Guilty.  Ashamed.  Fucked. He saw it.  He saw it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: explodes nearby.  Drenching him in sea spray. Will turns, raking his hand across his face.  Blinking.  Eyes stinging.  Trying to focus.  Trying to think this through... Hears a dog BARKING in the distance. Shakes his head.  Looks at his watch. Got to deal with the problem at hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, bursts into his room at the Lodge.  The shoulders of his coat still wet with sea spray.  Crosses to the area of the floor where Kay Connell's files are still spread out. Starts pressing the floorboards with the toe of his boot. Testing.  Testing.  Until...he finds the one that SQUEAKS. Gets down on his knees.  Hesitates.  Then jams his fingers in around the loose board.  Starts pulling it up.  Face reddening.  Knuckles whitening.  Slips his hand into the gap. Pulls out a muddy 357 RUGER. The killer's gun. Will, stares down at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, standing at the mouth of the ALLEY.  Just like the night before.  Steps inside.  Cautious.  Eyes darting. Peering into the shadows for the HOMELESS MAN... Not there.  Coast's clear.  Heads for the dumpster at the end of the alley.  Shoves it aside.  Looks down at... The DEAD DOG.  Rancid.  Rotting.  Will gags.  Holds a handkerchief to his face.  Waving away the flies. Then.  Pulls the 357 Ruger from his pocket.  Shrugs his coat off and wraps it around his hand and the gun.  Looks away. Fires a muffled SHOT into the dog's side.  The body kicks. Crouches down.  Feels along the dog's ribs for the bullet's point of entry.  Finds it.  Pulls out a PENKNIFE and extends one of the blades.  Cuts into the gash, fingers probing deep for the lodged bullet.  He finds it.  Pulls it out. Looks back at the dog.  Takes a deep breath.  Wipes his brow. A little smear of the dog's blood left on his forehead. Turns and pulls a bottle of RUBBING ALCOHOL from his pocket. Douses the bullet.  Cleaning it.  Glancing at his watch. Running out of time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rear of the Nightmute PD building.  Will, looking around, heads briskly for the back door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...steps into the HALLWAY leading towards the bullpen.  Hears VOICES.  Nearby.  Ducks back.  Waiting for them to fade. Safe.  Heads down towards the STORAGE ROOM.  Glancing briefly at the PICTURES hanging on the wall.  Of old time POLICE OFFICERS.  Striking brave poses...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The storage room.  Hot.  Stifling.  The moose antlers LOOMING over his shoulder.  Will pulls the evidence locker key from his pocket.  Unlocks the padlock.  Swings the door open. Pulls the Hap Eckhart envelope out.  Throwing a look over his shoulder.  Opens it.  Shakes out the bullet that was lodged in Hap's spine.  Then fishes a plastic bag from his pocket. The bullet he shot into the dead dog.  Drops that into the envelope and reseals it.  Hands shaking. Something.  Catches the corner of his eye.  He turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the locker mirror.  The blood smear still on his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will jumps.  Quickly wipes the smear off and turns.  Fred Duggar standing behind him.  RICH by his side.  Will clears his throat, shoves Hap's envelope into Fred's hand.  Then Farrell's.  Angry.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Dormer...

dialogue.raw_text: Walter Byrd.

dialogue.raw_text: When I was seven my mother and grandmother took me to Vancouver.  We were walking along the street one day when these two men ran past and snatched my grandmother's purse right from under her arm.  Right from under her arm.  That night a police officer came to our hotel room to ask us questions.  Stood the whole time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) His uniform looked brand new.  His shoes and badge were polished, his billy club, his belt buckle.  All perfect.  He was like a soldier, but better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Made a huge impression on me.  His goodness.  Gave me an instant respect for the police.  I tried to become a cop when I left high school, but...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Congenital problem.

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Oh.  We're here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gendreau Glacier.  Spilling down between two huge mountains. Enormous in its whiteness, its coldness, its silent power. Will and Walter walk up its face, away from the other tourists.  Walter leads the way.  Hands in his pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He points off to the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will's lip curls.  Watching him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know this glacier moves a quarter of an inch every day?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) And on a clear day you can see all the way over to Newtok.  There's a beautiful aviary over there.  We can go sometime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) It's actually cool for this time of year. Normally the temperature runs about...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will lunges at him.  Walter's eyes widen in surprise as he grabs him up by the collar.  Nose to nose.  Will barely keeping control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter flounders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His jaws tense, nostrils flare.  Walter, red-faced, sputtering...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will clenches his teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then a SHRIEK.  Will looks over
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You think this is a nice meeting we're having here?  Friendly?  Two people getting acquainted? (jerks him harder) You sick, coward, fuck.  I get up every morning of my life just to bring someone like you down.  Beating a seventeen year- old girl to death.  Washing her afterwards, cleaning her.  Make you feel like a real man? (tightens his grip) Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I outta end this right now.  Take a rock and smash your fucking skull in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I stood right behind you...I saw you look right into his eyes and shoot him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) ...Seattle's great hero.  Shooting his own partner.  I saw it all...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was an accident!  You hear me?  I didn't know it was him! (shakes him hard) I didn't know it was him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  Further down the glacier.  Having a snowball fight. Will looks back at Walter.  Has to take it easy.  Shoves him away in disgust.  Walter falls down onto the snow.  Dislodges his hearing aid. Watches Will pace.  Head throbbing.  Ribs, screaming in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter brushes the snow off the dislodged hearing aid.  Puts it back around his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gets up.  Brushes the snow from his butt.  Checks something in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks down at the kids.  Shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter turns back to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will stops short.  Eyes burning.  It's all he can do not to throttle this weed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter looks at him.  Scratches his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes out a handkerchief.  Blows his nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will runs his hands through his hair.  Half-crazed.  Heart pounding.  Turns to watch...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then why lie about it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I mean, I'm all for bending the truth. That's what I do in my novels.  It's my trade you might say.  But why cover it up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You don't have to tell me if you don't want to.  I'm sure you have some reason. Something noble.  I have faith in that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) They should be bundled up better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's your game, Byrd?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No game.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The phone call.  The knapsack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I figured we're partners on this one.  I mean, after what I saw...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's get one thing straight, Byrd.  We are partners on nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I research my novels.  I know the procedures.  You'd have cuffed me back at the ferry.  You'd have called for back- up, read me my rights, and gotten a search warrant for my apartment.  You're a well-respected detective.  There's no reason for you to be talking to me right now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) ...except that we could help each other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) So.  We're at an impasse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: down the glacier.  Making angels in the snow.  Their
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: carried along by the wind. Will, squeezes his eyes shut.  Trapped.  About to defy every instinct in his body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter steps up, tapping his hearing aid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter smiles.  Pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter rubs his hands together.  Thinking.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto) You're going to get a phone call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said you're going to get a phone call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (perks up) Oh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kay Connell had a signed copy of one of your books.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thought you might find that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to be brought in for questioning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Down at the station?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hisses) Yes down at the station.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.  Okay.  Brought in for questioning. Good.  I can write this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the ferry blows its HORN.  Low and loud.  Walter looks down at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts down.  Will watches him pass, has no choice but to follow.  Walter, going over the details in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snaps his fingers.  An idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will nods.  Walter smiles.  Spreads out his hands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Ferry's leaving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Something to divert...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) My gun.  You still have my gun, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Then that's the wild card.  Every detective story has a wild card.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean, "wild card?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  Boarding the ferry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter heads over to the ramp.  Will stops, grabbing his side.  A PANG through his ribs.  Excruciating.  Calls out to Walter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter looks back.  Waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gives his ticket to the TICKET TAKER.  Gets on.  Walks back to the stern.  Looks out at Will.  The HORN sounds again. Walter, at the rail.  Smiles.  The ferry's engine, churning up water.  Starting forward just as... Walter takes a MINI CASSETTE RECORDER from his pocket.  Holds it up for Will to see. Will, on shore, sees it.  A cold flash ripping through his body.  That motherfucker.  Bolts through some tourists towards the ramp but... A couple of GUYS are just pulling it in.  The Ticket Taker, grabs his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, jerks his arm away.  Stares off at the ferry.  Walter Byrd and his tape recorder.  Receding into the distance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Next ferry's in forty-five minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean "wild card?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll know.  At the questioning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Will) Full up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON a counter top.  Stuff thrown down.  Aspirin.  Band- aids.  Gauze.  Medical tape.  First aid cream.  Back pills. Sleeping pills.  Bottle of scotch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to reveal Will standing at the counter in the convenience store.  His entire body aching.  The CASHIER, throws him a look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have a cold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will exits the store.  A bag under his arm.  We Miss You, Kay looming over his shoulder.  Steps out onto the sidewalk and sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leaning against her truck.  Waiting for him.  Smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tingle, all across Will's body.  Christ.  This girl's everywhere!  He hunches into his coat.  Flicks up his collar. Doesn't want her to see him fully.  Nods down the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie grabs her bag.  Joins him.  They start walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulls a folder from her bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will takes the file.  Flips it open.  The death of his partner.  Neatly typed.  Neatly stapled.  Pulls out a pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He signs.  Hands it back to her.  She slips it into her bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A slight stutter in Will's step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie looks over at Will as they cross the street.  Studying his face.  His gait.  Noticing the slight limp in his right leg.  The cut on his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They arrive at the stone steps of the Pioneer Lodge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, finally looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turns and starts up the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie, watches him for a second.  Then calls out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will stops, turns to look back at her.  Confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slings the bag over her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Which way are you walking?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Back to the Lodge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I needed to get your signature on something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) The report on Detective Eckhart.  Chief made me finish it this morning.  Said it was taking too long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Aren't you going to read it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I trust you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Now I can help you with the Connell case. That writer's coming in tomorrow.  Walter Byrd.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Duggar called him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About an hour ago.  Said he was more than happy to cooperate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You haven't been sleeping much, have you, Detective Dormer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not really.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't that the difference between a good cop and a bad cop?  A good cop can't sleep 'cause a piece of the puzzle's missing.  A bad cop can't sleep 'cause his conscience won't let him. (smiles) You said that once, remember?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  But it sounds like something I would've said.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) See you tomorrow, Ellie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh!  I forgot to tell you.  The Puffins won.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) The baseball game.  Our team...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) ...We won.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clock flicks to 3:00 A.M.  Will, pacing in his room.  Shirt off.  Rib cage wrapped in a bandage.  Looking through...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  All from John Warfield.  He discards them one by one.  Can barely focus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the phone RINGS.  He lunges for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Interrupted by a CLICK...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter Byrd's voice.  Recorded from that afternoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, hears his own voice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then, another clumsy CLICK.  Walter Byrd gets on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up. Will SLAMS down the receiver.  Then again.  And again.  Yanks the cord out of the wall and HURLS the phone across the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (grabbing it) Listen to me, you son-of-a-bitch...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I saw you look right into his eyes and shoot him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) ...Seattle's great hero.  Shooting his own partner.  I saw it all...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) That was an accident!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddammit, Byrd!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'd have done the same thing, Will.  I know you would...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ...The DARK FIGURE.  Disappearing back into the fog.  Closing in around him like milky water... We whip out our SMITH 39/13...plunge in after him...taking chase...BREATHING hard...leaping from rock to rock...the FOG, blanket thick...tightening around us... Our feet.  Hit water.  Up to our ankles.  Icy cold.  We run...sloshing through...when...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Appears ahead.  Big and hulking...CRASHING towards us... We raise our weapon...quick as a flash...as the FIGURE emerges... And in a split second...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: FIGURE's - his eyes, brown and gentle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  We fire!  The FIGURE grips his gut, falls into the water. Heart POUNDING.  Adrenaline PUMPING.  We slosh towards the body.  Something...catching our eye...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lying in the rocks.  Off to the side.  We grab it.  Turn back to the body... And stop cold. That's when it hits us.  That's when we realize...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will bolts up.  White as a sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His body, drenched in sweat.  His breathing, quick and ragged.  Caught up in the twisted sheets of his bed.  Looks across the room and sees
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't know!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sitting in the corner.  Eating an apple with a penknife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles.  Sympathetic.  Looks over at the window just as... The BLANKET.  Drops to the floor. LIGHT floods the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You sure about that, buddy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: :02 A.M. With a GRUNT Will puts his back into it.  Shoving the heavy oak bureau towards the window.  Sweat beading his face. A...few...more...shoves.  And the bureau finally stands in front of the window.  WIll stands back to take a look.  Only covers half of it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: :35 A.M. Red-faced, Will leans into the wooden armoire.  Shimmying it towards the window...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie.  Sitting in her truck.  Parked behind the Pioneer Lodge.  Rubbbing her eyes.  Sleepy.  Looking up at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :35 A.M. With one last heave, Will gets the armoire to the window. Light still shining through the cracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :50 A.M. Will shoving magazines, blankets, sheets, pillows.  Anything. To fill the cracks.  To cover the light.  His eyes.  Like a crazy man's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a knock on the door.  Will turns.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Detective Dormer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rachel standing out in the hallway.  Will opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will gives a half-smile.  Fucking irony.  Heads back into...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (startled by his appearance) Will...I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a guy down the hall.  Complaining about the noise. (beat) Says he can't sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ...his room.  Rachel follows.  Looks around at the mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will grabs up a sweater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heads back over to the window.  Rachel now notices all the stuff piled up.  Softens her voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will.  Cramming the sweater into a crack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel walks up behind him.  His cramming, more desperate. More urgent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs a magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel reaches out.  Catches his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops.  Looks down at her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will suddenly realises what he's doing.  Absurd.  Pathetic. Pitiful.  Slowly turns to face Rachel. Her eyes, looking up at him.  His shoulders droop. Exhausted.  Rachel reaches up.  Catches him in her arms. Strong arms.  Caring.  Will buries his face in her neck. Wants to be swallowed up. Rachel holds him.  Arms encircling.  Will breathes her in. Sweet, soft, safe. Looks up.  His mouth suddenly finding hers.  A kiss, hungry, urgent.  His arms move to surround her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you alright?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did something happen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The light.  It keeps coming in...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will and Rachel in bed.  Spooning.  Rachel behind will, her finger tracing his scar.  Rain DRUMS against the window. Will.  Watching the raindrops streaming down the glass. Casting strange shadows against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will tenses his jaw.  Rachel, listens in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel reaches for Will's hand.  Squeezes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will turns slowly over to face her.  Her hair, splayed out on the pillow.  Her cheeks, flushed.  Her eyes, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel looks at him.  Goose pimples on her arms.  Realising the weight of the confession.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sits up.  Abrupt.  Wincing from the pain in his ribs. Rests his arms on his knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel rubs his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will closes his eyes.  The rain, PATTERING.  Rhythmic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a PAUSE.  Rachel, studying Will's back.  The cuts. The bruises.  Not sure how to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There was this guy named Weston Dobbs. Twenty-four.  Worked as a part-time stock boy in a copy store.  Every morning he'd sit at the only window in his apartment and watch an eight year-old boy get picked up by his carpool across the street.  And every afternoon he'd watch the boy get dropped off again.  He did this for about six months.  Until one day he got up the nerve to cross the street and grab the boy before his carpool came. Kept him in his apartment for three days. Tortured him.  Raped him.  Made him do things...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) When he was done, he got a rope and a kitchen stool and hanged the boy in the basement of the apartment building.  But he didn't do a good enough job.  The little boy's neck didn't break and he died from shock.  The landlord found him five days later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One of your cases?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me and Hap.  A year and a half ago.  I knew the second I met Dobbs that he was guilty.  Smug, cold.  Dead eyes.  We had circumstantial evidence, but nothing to tie him to it.  Nothing concrete.  Went over every inch of that apartment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We took some blood samples from the boy's body and planted them in his apartment. (beat) Arrested him the next day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There've been other cases.  Where we've changed results.  Pushed witnesses. Manipulated evidence. (rubs his face) But Dobbs.  I wanted Dobbs more than anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if someone finds out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're under investigation now.  Back in Seattle. (beat) Hap wanted to talk.  As soon as we got back.  Thought he could work out some kind of deal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, that's not going to happen now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think it was wrong?  What we did?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are two kinds of people in Alaska. Those who were born here and those who've come here to escape something in their lives. (beat) I wasn't born here, Will.  I'm in no position to judge anyone.  I'm not about that any more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) It's all about what you're willing to live with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The clock reads 6:00.  Will pulls on his trousers.  Goes to strap on his Smith 39/13 holster.  Grimaces with pain.  Looks at his back in the full-length mirror.  BLACK BRUISES seeping out from under his bandage. Puts the 39/13 and holster in the top drawer of the bureau. Turns and looks down at Rachel.  Sleeping soundly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) You were acquainted with the deceased, Kay Connell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will in the interrogation room.  Standing by the window. Tensed jaw.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Yes I was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sits at the table.  Hair combed, wet.  Shirt newly starched. A Styrofoam cup of coffee in front of him.  Playing the part. Fred sits opposite him.  Report file open.  Ellie, next to Fred.  Taking notes.  She's combed her hair, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter smiles modestly.  Looks over at Ellie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fred shoots Ellie a look.  She closes her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie hands Fred the hardback of Otherwise Engaged.  He holds it up.  Opened to the signature.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, from over by the window.  Interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter looks over.  Wide-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will turns.  Accusatory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter blinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fred shoots Will a look.  Ellie, watching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will heads over to Walter's chair.  Fists clenched in his pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to Fred and Ellie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fred stops Will with a look.  Had enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tense BEAT.  Will stares at Walter.  Revulsion.  Heads back over to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fred, sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter hesitates.  Takes a sip of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter furrows his brow.  Taps his hearing aid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie's eyes widen.  Fred glances at Will.  But Will's too busy watching this little man weave his web.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter looks right at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fred stands.  This is big.  Calls out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter takes a sip of his coffee.  Cup's empty.  Holds it out to Ellie.  Smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie nods, takes the cup.  Heads over to the coffee machine. Fred turns back to the door...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In what manner?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She was, not quite a "fan."  More an avid reader of my detective novels.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When did you first meet her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A year ago.  At one of my signings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where you signed this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened at that signing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She flattered me about my writing.  Asked if she could visit me.  To talk about my books.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did she?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.  Not that much at first.  But then she became more comfortable.  Started visiting me every week...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What was the nature of your relationship?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean, Detective Dormer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.

dialogue.raw_text: Expensive dresses.  A heart necklace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.

dialogue.raw_text: That boyfriend.  Randy.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.

dialogue.raw_text: What about him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He.  Well, he...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I don't want to talk out of school.  Kay told me things in the strictest of confidence.  As a friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Byrd.  Anything you can tell us could help out with this case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well.  He hit her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you sure about that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She'd come to me, sometimes in the middle of the night.  Bruises all over her back, her upper arms.  I pled with her to let me call the police, but she wouldn't hear it.  Wanted to keep it a secret.

dialogue.raw_text: Randy Stetz beat Kay Connell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angry) Ellie.

Cigarette butts, electric guitar, Hustler centerfolds tacked on the walls. He looks around.  Every inch of him revolting against what he's about to do.

Over to a stack of cardboard BOXES in the corner. She nudges through them, reading the writing on the tops.  In thick black pen.  Shoves a couple aside. Then.  Finds what she's looking for. dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) We're really going to miss you around here.
