direction.raw_text: Will, driving down Nightmute's main street.  He takes a left. Goes up a hill.  Glances out the window.  Passing by
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  A cluster of headstones.  Something catches his eye.  He stops the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, walking up to the wrought-iron gate surrounding the cemetery.  Stops.  Puts his hands up to the bars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the other side.  Newly dug.  A mound of dirt.  Flowers, scattered by the wind.  Daughter and Friend...1982-1999. Will.  Grips the bars.  As if he's seeing it for the first time.  Really seeing it. Closes his eyes. What have I done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will's REFLECTION in the mirror.  He's showered.  Hair's combed.  Put on a clean suit.  Steps back.  Smooths down his lapels.  Just right. Turns to face the room.  Bed's made, mess cleaned up.  He heads over to the bureau, pulls out his Smith 39/13.  Lays it on the bed. Unclips his badge from his belt.  Lays it on the bed.  Takes something from the bedside table.  The BULLET found in Hap Eckhart.  Lays it on the bed. All neat.  All ordered. Reaches under the mattress.  Pulls out the PHOTOGRAPH of a blurry Walter Byrd standing in front of a house.  A radio tower in the background.  The call numbers: WKOZ. Will studies it.  Tears it in half.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel in the back room behind reception.  A pullman's kitchen, a desk, an old recliner.  Pouring some milk into a bowl for a CAT.  A stray. Will walks in.  Rachel turns, smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will walks up to her.  Puts his arms around her.  Holds her, smells her, kisses her neck.  Pulls away.  Looks into her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't answer.  The cat, rubs against his leg.  PURRING.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I found a new friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Will.  What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will driving along a forest road.  Eyes dead ahead.  A map on the passenger seat.  By the fold, Kgun Lake circled in pencil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie working at her desk.  Looks up at the clock: 6:00. Gets up, grabs her down vest.  Heads for the door.  Farrell sticks the tip of his crutch in her path.  She stumbles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Very funny, Farrell...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: VIEW of the silver Jeep Cherokee.  The only car on the road.  The sky, white-grey.  The trees, a blanket of green. The Cherokee heads around a hairpin curve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel at reception.  Reading the paper.  Ellie walks in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, Rachel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will, scanning the treeline.  Takes a left fork then stops. Thought he saw something.  Grinds the gear, backs up.  Takes another look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a radio tower.  WKOZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel and Ellie, standing outside Will's room.  Ellie knocks again.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I would have seen if he came back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The CLICK of a key and the door opens.  Ellie strides in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stops.  Rachel behind her.  Taking in the strange feeling in the room.  Walks over to the bed.  Eyes riveted on the
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Detective Dormer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  On the bullet.  Rachel, behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie, her mind races.  Notices TORN PHOTOGRAPH PIECES in the trash can.  Reaches in and pulls some out.  A puzzle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is all this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will stops the car at the end of a narrow dirt driveway. Looming before him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: right on the lake.  Tall, wooden, in disrepair. Chipping yellow paint.  A ghost of what it once was.  The house from the photograph. INT. STUDY - HOUSE The CLANG of electric typewriter keys bang out a title:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: by Walter By
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hunched at his typewriter.  In an old study. Books stacked everywhere.  Light patches on the walls where pictures used to hang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: outside.  Walter cocks his head.  Gets up.  Walks over to the window. OUTSIDE.  Will walking up to the house.  Lucy and Desi jumping around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will opens the screen door with a CREAK.  Steps into the living room. Recoils from the smell.  Flies BUZZING.  Yellow plastic covering the sofas.  Boxes, books, papers, pictures piled high everywhere.  Wallpaper faded, peeling. Everything, decaying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie ripping along the forest road in her truck.  Gripping the wheel.  The photograph pieces, taped together on the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will heads down a hallway.  Dark, narrow, floorboards worn. More shit stacked up. Each step, careful, quiet.  Tracking.  Listening.  A BREEZE sweeps through.  The burned-out lightbulb hanging from the ceiling, starts swinging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will whips around.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Here to visit me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: standing there.  At the other end of the hallway. Shoulders slumped. Will shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: bouncing against the screen door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will takes a step forward...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly reaches into his jacket...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulls out his SMITH AND WESSON.  Walter.  Looks at the gun. Inches back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I'm here to end this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's your back-up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No back-up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not following procedure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Procedure went out the window a long time ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're on the same side, Will.  You know that.  After what we've been through together.  We're partners.  Bound by a secret.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's where you're wrong, Walter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) There is no secret.  Because the biggest difference between you and me is what we will or will not live with...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: darts out of sight.  Swings back into the doorway with a SHOTGUN...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  Will's shoulder explodes with blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie, jumping out of her truck.  Hears the sound.  Looks up at the big, yellow house.  Pulls out her Glock 40.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter walking down the hall.  Will, writhing on the floor, reaches for his back holster...gun's not there! Walter stands over him.  Swings his leg back and...CRACK! Kicks will in the ribs.  The pain, blinding.  Will GASPS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! again, CRACK! again, CRACK! again.  Walter's face. Calm, flushed.  A vein along his temple. Will's eyes flutter.  Blood, spewing from his lips.  A THUD! to his kidneys.  Walter stops, out of breath.  Hand on hip.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You give the police a bad name, Will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: suddenly shoots out.  Grabs the shotgun barrel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stumbles back.  The shotgun goes off.  BAM!  Chunks of ceiling rain down.  Walter falls to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie, heart POUNDING.  Kicks the front door open...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, covered in dry wall, struggling to his feet.  Reaches for his Smith and Wesson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kicks it out of the way.  It SKITTERS down the hall. Walter grabs his shotgun.  Scrambles to his feet.  Runs down to the end of the hall.  Ducks into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the library.  Dirty shelves, strings of dust.  Endless books.  He races over to a cabinet.  Yanks open a DRAWER...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, on his feet, trying to focus.  His suit, soaked with blood.  Looking for his gun.  Spots it, in the corner...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter jerks open another drawer.  A STACK OF BOOKS teeter on the top of the cabinet.  He finds what he needs.  SHELLS. Grabs a handful...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tumble down on top of him.  He CRIES out, covering his head...touches his ear, panics - hearing aid's gone! Looks up.  Will, coming down the hall...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will hobbles into the library.  Sweeps the room with this gun. No Walter. Steps on something, crushing it.  Looks down.  Walter's hearing aid.  Kicks it aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie.  In the front hall.  Following procedure.  Right hand gripping the gun.  Left supporting the butt. Blinks away sweat.  Facing three doorways.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will limps into the dining room.  Furniture stacked high. Eyes, darting.  Gun, covering.  Trying to stay conscious...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  The screen door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie.  Gun swinging.  Doorway one.  Doorway two.  Doorway three...SUDDENLY
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs past number one.  Big.  Shadowy.  The flash of a GUN. She wheels toward it.  Finger on the trigger...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...The FIGURE, passing.  Her heart, POUNDING.  Her finger...squeezing... Will Dormer or Walter Byrd? At the last second, she jerks the gun away.  The figure disappears.  She swallows.  Gripping the gun.  Follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sky, heavy with clouds.  The air, foreboding.  Will steals out the screen door.  Gun cocked.  Eyes scanning. Wind, bending the weeds, the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! a shot.  Out of nowhere.  Rips into his thigh.  Will
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: out.  BAM! a second shot.  Whizzes past him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...CRACK! the shot bites into the window frame.  Wings Ellie halfway across the room.  She drops to the floor.  Clutching her shoulder.  Flesh wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pulls herself over to a SIDEBOARD for cover.  Shrinks behind it.  Notices
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: sticking out from one of the drawers.  Nudges it open.  A flowered dress, some panty-hose, strands of long dark hair...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will.  On the ground.  Gripping his leg.  Looking wildly around.  No sign of Walter.  Then.  He sees it. Lucy and Desi.  Down by the boathouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boathouse.  Old, rotted wood.  Crumbling beams. Walter stands at a window.  Re-loading his shotgun.  He fumbles, drops a shell.  It rolls towards a crack in the floor.  Falls into the LAKE WATER below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  Walter levels the shotgun out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - the long, undulating WEEDS outside.

direction.raw_text: Will.  Pulling himself through the weeds.  Losing blood fast. Dragging his body.  Approaches the side of the BOATHOUSE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sticking out. Will ducks his head.  Winces in pain.  Breathing, becoming ragged.  Rounds to the other side.  Hoists himself up to another WINDOW.  Cautiously looks in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at the far window. Will jerks back.  Steps on the dock.  A plank CREAKS.  Shit. Peers back through the window. WALTER.  Still looking out.  Didn't hear a thing. Will remembers.  Walter doesn't have his hearing aid.  He's deaf on that side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter, looking out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - we see Will climbing in through the window.  Smearing blood along the sill, favoring his leg. Stands straight.  Levels his gun at Walter's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.  Walter continues staring out the window.  Will raises his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter jumps, whips around.  Comes face to face with the barrel of Will Dormer's gun.  Surprised.  Absently touches his deaf ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter looks at Will's 45.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men LOCK EYES.  Wind HOWLING through the boathouse. Killer and Detective.  Only a bullet separating them.

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Walter?

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Walter!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wild card.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Drop the gun, Walter.

dialogue.raw_text: That jammed the last time, remember?

direction.raw_text: suddenly jerks up his shotgun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  He stumbles back.  Hit in the gut. Will's Smith and Wesson, smoking.  No longer jammed. Walter, touches the blood.  Looks back at Will.  Staggering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  The rotting floor gives way beneath him.  He CRIES out, falls.  Drops into the icy water below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Will steps over to the hole.  Looks down at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: floating on his back.  Looking up at him.  Water washing over his body.  Eyes, pleading.  Fading.  A wave, gently pulls him away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Another J. Brody mystery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Will staggers out on to the dock.  Drops his gun.  Crashes to his knees.  Falls back.  His face, pale.  Lying against the wood of the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Start to fall.  Washing the blood from his skin. Puckering the lake water.  Will's eyes...flutter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...running along the dock.  Heavy boots...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will squints against the rain.  Makes out the face of
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Detective Dormer!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hovering over him.  He gives a half-smile.

direction.raw_text: Ellie kneels down next to him.  Pulls over her vest.  Covers him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will looks at her bloody shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie, tearing off her boot.  Yanks off her sock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will, fading fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie, wraps the sock around his leg.  Starts twisting.  Will grimaces.  Ellie swallows.  Doesn't want to ask this.

direction.raw_text: Will nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pained looks crosses Ellie's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: God, you're a pain in the ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're shot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to make a tourniquet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Walter Byrd killed Kay Connell.  Her things are in the house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Byrd's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You shot Detective Eckhart, didn't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you mean to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  But I covered it up.  I lied.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: drumming down around them.  Will, takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His blood, pumping out in rivulets.  Ellie looks down at him. Her hero.  Moves up to the wound in his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will reaches up a feeble hand.  Stops her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyelids, growing heavy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellie blinks away the tears.  Knows what he means.  What he wants.  Watches as the calm spreads over him. Will closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will opens his eyes.  She ties the second sock around his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gets up.  Slips her arms under his shoulders.  Starts hoisting him up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will.  Struggling to his knees.  Every inch of him, screaming in pain.  Gets to his feet.  Arm slung around this tiny, young woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they head, slowly but surely, back down the dock.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Because I just couldn't be wrong. (looks at her) Don't ever get that way, Ellie.  Don't ever lose your way.  It blurs the line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This one looks worse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers) Just let me sleep, Ellie...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Let me sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I will not let you sleep.  If you've lost your way then you have to make it right. That's the only way.  That's what you'd tell me.  I've been a detective for four weeks and I say you're coming with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) C'mon...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about your shoulder?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry.  I'll have a cool scar.
